oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Rice School Rhythm Band, from the Nashville Times, 1940
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A captioned photo from the Nashville Times (1940), about “The Rhythm Band of the Rice Kindergarten and Primary School gave a program recently at the Hobson Methodist Church for the William B. Bate Chapter, U. D. C. and for the beginners’ department of the Hobson church. Members of the band seen from left to right above, are as follows: Phillip Hummel, Joanne Scott, Neel Beard, Nancy Ann Simmons, Bobby Robinson, Betty Jean Earhart, Betty Banker, Jack Payne, R. V. Hickey, and Joe Payne.” One of the first kindergartens in Nashville was opened in the 1920s by Zula Smith Rice on Scott Avenue. Forms part of the Nashville Times newspaper collection. 1 digital photo.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Rice Kindergarten and Primary School (Nashville, Tenn.); United Daughters of the Confederacy. William B. Bate Chapter (Nashville, Tenn.); Hobson Methodist Church (Nashville, Tenn.)
